basics.name: Frederik Leidloff
basics.label: Senior Frontend Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a Berlin based Senior Frontend Engineer looking for new opportunities (part-time) close to Neuk√∂lln. The past years, I worked at mobile.de and marktplaats.nl as Frontend Engineer and Team Lead with different technologies, including React.js, ES6, less, node.js, CSS3, HTML5, mocha and many more. I'm also an experienced facilitator for retrospectives and love working with agile methodologies.

work.summary: Working as a Team Lead in an agile core mobile.de Software Team focussing on APIs and 360 degree images.
In 2018, I worked few months in our consumer team helping to make our main consumer-facing application -- the public search -- responsive
Working for 6 months inside the ebay universe at marktplaats in Amsterdam. Most interesting project was 'web push notifications'
As part of the mobile.de long-term-monetization project, I rewrote the inventory list with React.js.

I was working on a Call Tracking solution for all mobile.de car dealers. Furthermore, I started to facilitate retrospectives for other teams. In the beginning of 2016, I received the Critical Talent Award from eBay.

I started working at mobile.de as Junior Software Engineer for the AutoAct Team. From 2014 on, I was working on the commercial side of the mobile.de product. Additionally, I took part in organized and facilitating a Design Thinking Workshop for the mobile.de commercial team.

education.studyType: Master of Science in IT-Systems Engineering
education.summary: I Specialized in Internet & Security Technology and wrote my master's thesis on "Sensor Fusion for Understanding Design Thinking Teams" (Grade: A-).

education.institution: HPI School of Design Thinking, Potsdam

education.studyType: Bachelor of Science in IT-Systems Engineering
education.summary: I Specialized in internet technologies and systems (Grade: B+).
